content.text: Calculate the volume of the water in the tank

Calculate the mass of the water in the tank

pressure =   .........

Calculate the height \(h\) of the waterfall

The Sun is the source of energy for most energy resources used to produce electricity
State two energy resources that have another source for their energy
Solids have a fixed shape. Liquids adapt to the shape of their container. Gases fill their container
Explain in terms of forces between molecules and arrangement of molecules, why solids, liquids and gases have these properties
Solids
Liquids
Gases
Calculate the energy supplied to the kettle by the electricity supply
electrical energy =   .........

At 3.5 minutes, the temperature of the water reaches \(100^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\). The volume of the water in the kettle is \(1700\mathrm{cm}^3\) and its density is \(1.0\mathrm{g / cm}^3\). The specific heat capacity of water is \(4200\mathrm{J / (kg^{\circ}C)}\)
Calculate the thermal energy gained by the water
thermal energy =   .........
Calculate the efficiency of the kettle
efficiency =   .........
An electric kettle contains water at a temperature of \(19^{\circ}\mathrm{C}.\) The kettle has a power rating of \(3.0\mathrm{kW}\) and is switched on for 3.5 minutes
region around A in the diagram
region around B in the diagram

On Fig. 6.1, draw a double-headed arrow to show **one** wavelength
The loudness of the sound increases at the same pitch
State and explain any change there would be in the pattern of wavefronts shown in Fig. 6.1
The wave passes into water
State and explain any change in the pattern of wavefronts shown in Fig. 6.1
Fig. 6.1 represents wavefronts of a sound wave travelling in air from left to right

Each principal focus of the lens is labelled F

Label the image I
Describe the nature of the image I
Images formed by lenses sometimes have coloured edges
Suggest a reason for this

On Fig. 8.1, draw the electric field pattern around the sphere

A magnet and a coil are attached separately to a door and a door frame as shown in Fig. 10.1
The purpose of the arrangement is to activate a circuit connected to an LED indicator when the door is opening or closing. This will provide a visual indication that the door is being used
Initially, the door is closed and then it is opened

reason 1
reason 2

On Fig. 11.1, complete the path of each \(\alpha \cdot\) particle

A detector of radioactivity in a laboratory indicates an average of 16 counts/min when no radioactive samples are present. A radioactive sample of half-life 1.5 days is placed close to the detector, which indicates a count rate of 208 counts/min
Calculate the count rate that is indicated 6 days later
count rate =   .........  counts/min
The waste from nuclear power stations includes the isotopes technetium-99, tin-126 and selenium-79. These isotopes are radioactive with half-lives of many thousands of years
State **three** economic and environmental consequences of producing this waste
